did.unittitle: Paul Muldoon papers, 1939-2010
did.physdesc: 53.25 linear ft. (112 boxes) and 175 oversized papers (OP)
did.abstract: Papers of Irish poet Paul Muldoon, including correspondence, writings by Muldoon and others, printed material, business and personal papers, photographs and audiovisual material.

accessrestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Subseries 1.1, Alphabetical Correspondence, some files are closed without the written permission of Paul Muldoon. Letters by Seamus Heaney are closed to researchers. Letters by Gerard Quinn are closed until Quinn's death.

userestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Writings by Ted Hughes (letters and literary works) may not be reproduced without the written permission of Carol Hughes.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: [after identification of item(s)], Paul Muldoon papers, Manuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library, Emory University.

processinfo.head: Processing
processinfo.p: Sarah Quigley, Maggie Greaves, Michael Hessel-Mial and Will Love, 2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Paul Muldoon was born in County Armagh in 1951. He attended Queen's University in Belfast where he studied English literature under Seamus Heaney. In 1973, the year he graduated from Queen's, Faber and Faber published his first collection of poems. From 1973 to 1986 he worked as a radio and television producer for BBC Northern Ireland. He moved to the United States in 1987 and has held various university teaching posts. He currently lives in New Jersey and is the Howard G. B. Clark '21 Professor at Princeton University and Chair of the Peter B. Lewis Center for the Arts. Muldoon is married to novelist Jean Hanff Korelitz, with whom he has two children.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of the papers of Irish poet Paul Muldoon from 1939-2010, including correspondence, writings by Muldoon and others, printed material, business and personal papers, photographs and audiovisual material. The papers document Muldoon's creative work since the 1960s, including poetry, television and radio scripts for the BBC, drama and music. Correspondence in the collection consists primarily of letters to Muldoon from others, with only a few copies of letters written by Muldoon. The correspondence documents Muldoon's relationships with other Irish poets such as Ciaran Carson, Seamus Heaney, Michael Longley and Derek Mahon. Writings by Muldoon include drafts, proofs and other materials relating to his work as a poet, translator, and lyricist, as well as various types of prose writing. Writings by others include works by other Irish poets, interviews with Muldoon, and essays and theses about Muldoon's work.

Printed material consists of published writings by and about Muldoon, published writings by other authors, as well as some collected publications. Promotional material includes posters, flyers, brochures and other printed material publicizing and promoting Muldoon's work, poetry readings and other appearances. Business and personal papers consist primarily of publishing contracts, but also contain materials such as Muldoon's curriculum vitae, travel itineraries, appointment books and royalty statements. Photographs include portraits and snapshots of Muldoon, along with family members, friends and colleagues. Finally, the audiovisual material in the collection consists of recordings of performances of Muldoon's work, and a small number of interviews with Muldoon and reviews of Muldoon's poetry.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into eight series: (1) Correspondence, (2) Writings by Paul Muldoon, (3) Writings by others, (4) Printed material, (5) Promotional materials, readings, and appearances, (6) Business and personal papers, (7) Photographs, and (8) Audiovisual material.

did.unittitle: Correspondence, 1962-2005

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists largely of incoming letters received by Muldoon between 1962 and 2005. The alphabetical correspondence is organized according to correspondent or subject and reflects Muldoon's original arrangement. Correspondents include Ciaran Carson, Peter Fallon, Seamus Heaney, Michael Longley, Medbh McGuckian, and Derek Mahon. A small number of letters by Paul Muldoon are also present. Along with conventional hand- or type-written correspondence, the series also includes extensive email correspondence, printed from Muldoon's computer. Correspondence of a more general nature may be found in the second subseries. Manuscript items in the correspondence series have been noted in the container list and cross references have been added.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: (1.1) Alphabetical correspondence and (1.2) General correspondence.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Subseries 1.1, Alphabetical Correspondence, some files are closed without the written permission of Paul Muldoon. Letters by Seamus Heaney are closed to researchers. Letters by Gerard Quinn are closed until Quinn's death.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Writings by Ted Hughes (letters and literary works) may not be reproduced without the written permission of Carol Hughes.

did.unittitle: Alphabetical correspondence, 1962-2005

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of correspondence sent and received between 1962 and 2005, arranged alphabetically by Muldoon by correspondent name or subject. Correspondents include Ciaran Carson, Peter Fallon, Seamus Heaney, Michael Longley, Medbh McGuckian, and Derek Mahon. Subjects include particular works and publications by Muldoon, as well as topics related to Ireland, English-language poetry and Muldoon's professional associations. Correspondence with composer Daron Hagen, as it largely concerns their collaborative works, is located in Subseries 2.2, Dramatic Works and Lyrics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order with restricted correspondence at the end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of general correspondence to Muldoon from 1969-2005, including some fan mail and letters relating to one-time readings and appearances by Muldoon. There is no overlap between the correspondents in this subseries and those in subseries 1.1, Alphabetical correspondence.

Writings by Muldoon, circa 1960s-2004

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of writings by Paul Muldoon from the 1960s-2004, including poetry, dramatic works, and lyrical contributions to collaborations with composer Daron Hagen and singer-songwriter Warren Zevon. The series also includes translations, children's poetry, prose works, notebooks and Belfast Group sheets. The materials retain Muldoon's original arrangement wherever possible.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into seven subseries: (2.1) Poetry, (2.2) Dramatic works and lyrics, (2.3) Translations, (2.4) Children's poetry, (2.5) Prose, (2.6) Notebooks, and (2.7) Belfast Group sheets.

did.unittitle: Poetry, circa 1960s-2003

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of the poetry of Paul Muldoon from the 1960s-2003, including manuscript and typescript drafts, as well as proofs and other material relating to the publication process. The earliest poems in the collection were located in a single file labeled "First Poems" followed by a similar file labeled "Early Poems." The distinction between these two files has been preserved even though a number of these poems were later published in the early chapbooks--Knowing My Place and Spirit of Dawn--as well as in New Weather and in Mules. Later manuscripts follow more closely the chronology of Muldoon's published work. Groups of poems that could not clearly be linked to any one collection have been arranged in approximate chronological order as follows: Miscellaneous poems, circa 1978-1983, Miscellaneous poems, circa 1983-1986, Miscellaneous poems, circa 1986-1996 and Uncollected poetry, circa 1995-2000. Where poems lack a clear title, they have been alphabetized by their first line (indicated with an ellipses).

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged in chronological order by volume.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of dramatic works and lyrics composed by Muldoon from the 1970s through the 2000s. Because the dating of these materials is more tentative, they are arranged in alphabetical order, with the exception of Shining Brow and Bandanna, works that Muldoon collaborated on with Daron Hagen. The scripts have been divided into radio and television scripts for the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC), Muldoon's independent dramatic work, and lyrics Muldoon composed with Rob Mathes for their band, Rackett.

Because Shining Brow and Bandanna are the most collaborative of Muldoon's works, and because their development spreads over an unusually large number of years, all of the related materials are in a single grouping. Within this grouping, the materials fall into four areas: (1) manuscript materials, (2) correspondence with Daron Hagen, (3) correspondence with others, and (4) miscellaneous publicity materials and clippings. The correspondence with Daron Hagen covers their work together on operas Shining Brow, Bandanna, Vera of Las Vegas, and on Muldoon Songs: The Waking Father. In addition, general correspondence with Daron Hagen appears in this subseries, as the bulk of their correspondence concerns their collaborative works.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order.

Children's poetry, 1981-2004

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of children's poetry written by Paul Muldoon from 1981-2004. The subseries documents the writing and publication of all four of Muldoon's children's collections: The O-O's Party, The Last Thesaurus, The Noctuary of Narcissus Batt, and Reverse Flannery. Also included is a small amount of uncollected children's poetry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of Muldoon's prose writings from the 1970s-2004, including complete typescripts for The Faber Book of Beasts, and The End of the Poem: Oxford Lectures in Poetry; and extensive number other essays and lectures; reviews of books and movies; and scripts for the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC). Also included are a number introductions for readings by other writers.

Writings by others, 1939-2004

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists writings by others sent to Paul Muldoon from 1939-2004. The series includes works from poets such as Seamus Heaney, Ciaran Carson, Michael Longley and Tess Gallagher, as well as unpublished theses and critical studies on Muldoon's work. The series also includes a discussion on poetry between Louis MacNeice and F. R. Higgins from 1939 with notes written in the margins by Muldoon, as well as materials relating to published interviews with Muldoon.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: (3.1) Poetry and (3.2) Theses and unpublished articles, essays, and interviews.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of poems written by other authors from 1978-2004, including Seamus Heaney, Ciaran Carson, Michael Longley and Tess Gallagher. Most files include an unpublished typescript, and some files include notes and supplementary art work.

Theses and unpublished articles, essays, and interviews, 1939-2004

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists primarily of writings about Muldoon's poetry from approximately 1987-2004, including theses, unpublished articles, and essays, as well as transcripts of interviews with Muldoon. Most files contain an original copy of the essay, article, or interview, with some files containing accompanying correspondence and cover letters. The subseries also includes a discussion on poetry between Louis MacNeice and F. R. Higgins from 1939 with notes written in the margins by Muldoon

Printed material, circa 1940s-2005

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of printed material by Paul Muldoon, about Paul Muldoon, and general printed items from the 1940s-2005. Included are published reviews written by Muldoon, reviews of Muldoon's work written by others, and publications of individual poems by Muldoon. Also included are published reviews of works by other authors, as well as printed material not directly related to Muldoon. The bound volumes include published poetry collections by other poets, anthologies, journals, and Catholic youth guide books. Journals and newspapers include The Observer and The Listener, as well as The New Yorker and The Irish Times.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into four subseries: (4.1) Writings by Paul Muldoon, (4.2) Writings by others, (4.3) Clippings arranged by volume, and (4.4) Printed/bound material

did.unittitle: Writings by Paul Muldoon, 1969-2004

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of printed material by Muldoon from 1969-2004, including poems and essays published in newspapers and journals. All files contain a copy of the published poem or essay and some files contain supplementary correspondence and writings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged in chronological order.

Writings by others, 1969-2005

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of published writings by other authors from 1969-2005. The writings are either written about Muldoon or are written by his close associates. Each folder contains a copy of the writing, and some files contain accompanying correspondence.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of clippings from newspapers and journals from 1973-2005, including reviews of Muldoon's works and interviews with Muldoon. Following Muldoon's arrangement, these clippings are arranged according to the volume they concern. There are additional folders containing material on commissioned works, such as the Oscar Wilde memorial, and material on Muldoon's collaborations with Warren Zevon. A large amount of unorganized and miscellaneous clippings follow.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged in chronological order by date of publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of material created to publicize and promote Muldoon and his work from 1973-2005. It includes materials from the British Broadcasting Company (BBC), posters featuring poems by Muldoon, and notices of readings given by Muldoon in the U.S. and elsewhere. The series also includes a number of items not directly related to Muldoon, including posters advertising the work of other writers, of literary festivals, and of musical events.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: (5.1) British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) materials, (5.2) Promotional materials, and (5.3) Readings and appearances.

scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of promotional material from the British Broadcasting Corporation from 1973-1985, including director's packets, production materials, notes and schedules.

Assorted promotional and artistic materials, including two posters from Wake Forest University Press, announcement of Maria Simonds-Gooding exhibition, print of Paul Klee painting "They're Biting," announcement for Dingle Peninsula Festival of St. Brendan, and a Literary Map of Princeton, New Jersey

Assorted promotional and artistic materials, continued, including Harvard College Library of reading by Muldoon and Seamus Heaney (four copies), music and lyrics of "Muldoon the Solid Man" by Edward Harrigan, 1974 Arts Council announcement of reading by James Simmons and Muldoon, announcement of reading by Pm at Mount Holyoke College , Morden Tower Poetry Reading announcement of reading by James Simmons and Muldoon, Steps Theater's "Poets in Person" evening with Muldoon and Douglas Dunn, and promotional photograph of Muldoon reading
First Trust calendar, with Muldoon poem "Ma" printed on October 1996

Evening Telegraph, June 16, 1904, with extensive holograph notes and "Muldoon" written at top
"New Poetry from the United Kingdom," announcement for reading including Muldoon sponsored by the Library of Congress

Miscellaneous Faber enclosures
National Poetry Month poster, no date
Readings and appearances, 1980-2005

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of printed materials relating to events involving Muldoon from 1980-2005. Most of the events feature Muldoon poetry readings, but the subseries also includes workshops and classes led by Muldoon, poetry competitions judged by Muldoon, and various events that Muldoon attended but at which he did not speak.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of the business and personal papers of Muldoon from 1973-2010. It is comprised mostly of royalty statements from publishers, and pay slips from the BBC and academic institutions. Various drafts of Muldoon's curriculum vitae are also included, as are personal bank and pension fund statements. Royalty statements and contracts have been included below unless attached to other correspondence, in which case they are filed under that correspondent's name.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: (6.1) Royalty statements and contracts and (6.2) Personal papers.

did.unittitle: Royalty statements and contracts, 1980-2004

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of statements, contracts, and receipts from Muldoon's publishing agreements from 1980-2004. In addition to publishing agreements, this subseries includes receipts from Muldoon's newspaper submissions and other receipts related to Muldoon's business affairs and travels.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of photographs of Paul Muldoon from the 1950s-2004. Included are photographs of Paul Muldoon alone, with family members, family members alone, Paul Muldoon with others, and others alone. Where there is confirmation of a date, it is noted. The series includes a number of series of promotional shots of Paul Muldoon, as well as a substantial number of family photographs and photos with authors such as Seamus Heaney, Peter Fallon, Michael Longley and their families.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series contains audio and video recordings relating to the work of Paul Muldoon.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged by format.

did.unittitle: Audio reel: Seamus Deane reviewing Muldoon, Why Brownlee Left
Audiotape: Leonard Lopate Show, "Please Explain: How to Read a Poem," featuring Muldoon and Molly Peacock, WNYC, recorded December 3, 2004
Audiotape: Review of Latest Book of Poems
Compact Disc: Edward T. Cone, commercial recording of chamber compositions, including "New Weather," set to four poems by Paul Muldoon

Compact disc: various artists, "The Rose & The Briar: unequalized recording, July 26 2004 [soundtrack to book of essays on American music edited by Greil Marcus, "Blackwatertown" written by Paul Muldoon and performed by The Handsome Family]
Compact disc: radio recording related to the 2004 Shakespeare Prize, awarded to Paul Muldoon in Hamburg, Germany
Videotape: "Omnibus--Squeezing the Frog," BBC, August 13, 1987
